author: chron.com
title: Culture scene: Oct. 1-7
text:
Photo: Amitava Sarkar Image 1 of / 3 3 Katelyn May and other artists of Houston Ballet are featured in﻿﻿ "Reveal," one of three works on Houston Ballet's Fall Mixed Repertory Program.﻿
Photo: Amitava Sarkar Katelyn May and other artists of Houston Ballet are featured... Image 2 of 3 Soo Youn Cho is among the dancers who shine in Stanton Welch's "Tapestry," one of three works on Houston Ballet's Fall Mixed Repertory Program through Oct. 4 at Wortham Theater Center.
Photo: Amitava Sarkar Soo Youn Cho is among the dancers who shine in Stanton Welch's... Image 3 of 3 New collages by Kelly Moran are on view in the solo show "Only Human" at d.m. allison art through Oct. 17.
Photo: D.m. Allison New collages by Kelly Moran are on view in the solo show "Only... Culture scene: Oct. 1-7 1 / 3 Back to Gallery Theater
One Man, Two Guvnors: The Alley Theatre inaugurates its new Hubbard Stage with the Houston premiere of Richard Bean's London and Broadway hit. A reworking of Carlo Goldoni's 18th-century classic "The Servant of Two Masters," transplanted to 1960s Brighton, the farce centers on a hapless fellow who winds up working for two bosses at the same time and goes to outrageous lengths to keep each from finding out about the other. Previews at 8 p.m. Friday-Saturday, 2:30 and 7:30 p.m. Sunday; 7:30 p.m. Tuesday; opens at 7:30 p.m. Wednesday; through Nov. 1; Alley Theatre, 615 Texas; $21-$68; 713-220-5700, alleytheatre.org .
Matilda: National tour brings the Houston premiere of the London and Broadway smash based on Roald Dahl's children's classic. With book by Dennis Kelly, music and lyrics by Tim Minchin, the musical chronicles the travails and triumphs of Matilda, a young girl who uses her love of books, plus emerging telekinetic powers, to cope with her horrid parents and the even more horrible headmistress of her school. Previews at 7:30 p.m. Tuesday-Wednesday; opens at 7:30 p.m. Oct. 8; through Oct. 18; tour presented by TUTS at Hobby Center, 800 Bagby; $30-$100; 713-558-8887, TUTS.com .
Bonnie & Clyde: Houston premiere of Frank Wildhorn, Don Black and Ivan Menchell's 2011 musical about Clyde Barrow and Bonnie Parker, the notorious 1930s lovers, robbers and killers. 7:30 p.m. Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays, 3 and 8:30 p.m. Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Oct. 11; Hobby Center, 800 Bagby; $25-$49; 713-558-8887, tutsunderground.com .
Peter Pan 360: J.M. Barrie's classic fantasy about the boy who refuses to grow up returns in this touring big-top production, with elaborate 360-degree projections and flying effects. 7:30 p.m. Tuesdays-Fridays, 11:30 a.m., 3:30 and 7:30 p.m. Saturdays, 1:30 and 5:30 p.m. Sundays, through Oct. 25. Threesixty Theatre, 4747 U.S. 59 S.; $25-$75; 800-745-3000, peterpan360.com, ticketmaster.com .
The Honky Tonk Angels: Ted Swindley's musical about three aspiring country singers who meet on a Nashville-bound bus. 7:30 p.m. Wednesdays-Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays; through Nov. 8; Stages Repertory Theatre, 3201 Allen Parkway; $23-$49; 713-527-0123, stagestheatre.com .
Plantanos y Collard Greens: David Lamb's comedy about an African-American man and a Latina woman who fall in love but find their relationship challenged by the prejudices and misconceptions of their families and friends. 7:30 p.m. Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays, 2 and 8 p.m. Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Oct. 18; Ensemble Theatre, 3535 Main; $23-$50; 713-520-0055, ensemblehouston.com .
The Danube: In Marie Irene Fornes' experimental play, characters in 1938 Budapest find themselves falling prey to a mysterious sickness. 8 p.m. Thursdays-Saturdays, through Oct. 17; Catastrophic Theatre, 1119 I-10 E.; pay-what-you-can admission; 713-522-2723, catastrophictheatre.com .
This Is Our Youth: Kenneth Lonergan's play depicts 48 hours in the lives of three lost souls on the brink of adulthood, caught in a tangle of drug deals and stolen money. 7:30 p.m. Thursday, 8 p.m. Friday-Saturday; Hune Company at the Living Room, 1201 Stanford; $20-$28; 713-334-1291, hunecompany.com .
Much Ado About Nothing: Romantic comedy by William Shakespeare. 8 p.m. Friday-Saturday and Oct. 8-10, 3 p.m. Sunday; Rice Theatre, Hamman Hall at Rice University; $10; 713-348-4005, arts.rice.edu .
Vanya and Sonia and Masha and Spike: Christopher Durang's comic riff on the plays of Anton Chekhov. 8 p.m. Friday-Saturday; Theatre Southwest, 8944-A Clarkcrest; $18; 713-661-9505, theatresouthwest.org .
Autumn in New York: Cabaret revue collects songs associated with New York performers such as Paul Simon, Barbra Streisand and Billy Joel. 7:30 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, through Oct. 24; also, 2 p.m. Oct. 18; no show Oct. 10; Music Box Theatre, 2623 Colquit; $27-$37; 713-522-7722, themusicboxtheater.com .
Classical music
Houston Symphony: Andrés Orozco-Estrada conducts Bartok's Divertimento for Strings and Schumann's fairy-tale cantata "The Pilgrimage of the Rose," with the Houston Symphony Chorus and six vocal soloists. 8 p.m. Saturday, 2:30 p.m. Sunday; Jones Hall, 615 Louisiana. An abridged version of the program, with commentary, plays at 7:30 p.m. Thursday, at Stude Concert Hall, Rice University; $25-$129; 713-224-7575, houstonsymphony.org .
St. Cecilia Chamber Music Society: "In Honor of Nadia: Music by students of Nadia Boulanger" features chamber works by Francaix, Aaron Copland, Irving Fine and others. 7:30 p.m. Tuesday. St. Stephen's Episcopal Church, 1805 W. Alabama; $30; 713-331-0359, stceciliachambermusichouston.org .
Houston Choral Society: "Shout for Joy" concert, in collaboration with the Prairie View A&M University Concert Chorale, spans African-American spirituals and music of Brahms, Rachmaninoff and Beethoven. 7 p.m. Saturday; Foundry United Methodist Church, 8350 Jones; $25; 832-495-3030, houstonchoral.org .
Dance
An Evening With Houston Ballet Program: The company performs Christopher Bruce's "Ghost Dances," Stanton Welch's "Tapestry" and Garrett Smith's "Reveal"; 8 p.m. Thursday; Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavilion, 2005 Lake Robbins, The Woodlands; $20, free mezzanine and lawn seating; 281-363-3300, woodlandscenter.org .
Houston Ballet Fall Mixed Repertory: Christopher Bruce's "Ghost Dances," Stanton Welch's "Tapestry" and Garrett Smith's new "Reveal" are a stellar program. 7:30 p.m. Friday-Saturday, 2 p.m. Sunday; Wortham Theater Center, 501 Texas; $20-$145; 713-227-2787, houstonballet.org .
Dance Infusion: Uptown Dance Company performs works by Krissy Richmond, Alex Pandiscio and Beth Gulledge-Brown. 7 p.m. Friday-Saturday; Midtown Arts and Theater Center Houston, 3400 Main; $15-$30; 713-874-5875, matchouston.org .
Wishing Well: Ashley Horn's site-specific work celebrates the spirit and architecture of the Orange Show; 2 and 7 p.m. Saturday; the Orange Show Center for Visionary Art, 2402 Munger; $5-$25, ashleyhorndance.com .
Art museums
Art League Houston: "Amy Blakemore: I Ain't Tellin' " and "Forrest Prince: The Greatest of All Is Love," through Nov. 7; 1953 Montrose; 713-523-9530, artleaguehouston.org . FREE
Asia Society Texas Center: "Drawn From Nature," through Feb. 21; $5; 1370 Southmore; 713-496-9901, asiasociety.org .
Blaffer Art Museum: "Time/Image" and "Zina Saro-Wiwa: Did You Know We Taught Them How to Dance?," through Dec. 12; 4173 Elgin; 713-743-9521, blafferartmuseum.org . FREE
Contemporary Arts Museum Houston: "Texas Design Now," through Nov. 29; and "Whispering Bayou," through Nov. 1; 5216 Montrose; 713-284-8250, camh.org . FREE
DiverseWorks: "Katie Grinnan: Nocturnal Hologram," through Nov. 14; 4102 Fannin, Suite 200; 713-223-8346, diverseworks.org . FREE
Galveston Art Center: "Eric Schnell: Binder," through Sunday; 2501 Market, Galveston; 409-763-2403, galvestonartcenter.org . FREE
Holocaust Museum Houston: "Roman Vishniac," through Jan. 24; 5401 Caroline; 713-942-8000, hmh.org .
Houston Center for Contemporary Craft: "What Happened Today?/The Collective Cover Project," two large-scale installations by Ann Morton; and "Wendy Maruyama: The wildLIFE Project," through Jan. 3; 4848 Main; 713-529-4848, crafthouston.org . FREE
Katy Contemporary Arts Museum: "Deconstruction Beauty," works by Ken Mazzu and Felipe Lopez, through Nov. 15, 805 Avenue B, Katy; 832-857-1340, katycam.com .
Menil Collection: "Apparitions: Frottages and Rubbings From 1860 to Now," through Jan. 3; "Affecting Presence and the Pursuit of Delicious Experiences," through Nov. 8; "MicroCosmos: Details From the Carpenter Collection of Arctic Art," through Feb. 21; 1533 Sul Ross; 713-525-9400, menil.org . FREE
Museum of Fine Arts, Houston: "Mark Rothko: A Retrospective," through Jan. 24; "Roman Vishniac Rediscovered," through Jan. 3; "Shadow Monsters," through Oct. 31; $7.50-$23; 5601 Main; 713-639-7300, mfah.org .
Galleries
Farida Abedin: "Geometric Love," through Wednesday; Samara Gallery, 3911 Main; 713-999-1009, samaragallery.com .
John Adelman: "Further," through Oct. 17; Nicole Longnecker Gallery, 2625 Colquitt; 713-591-4997, longneckergallery.com .
Ask Forgiveness: Installation by Nick Barbee, through Oct. 24; GalleryHomeland, 2327 Commerce, No. 108; companion show "Good Riddance," through Oct. 28; HomeCore, 2010 Commerce, Unit B; 503-819-9656, galleryhomeland.org .
The Bridge Club Collaborative: "Cut," through Oct. 24; Art Palace, 3913 Main; 832-390-1273, artpalacegallery.com .
Sandi Seltzer Bryant: "New Works," and "Troy Dugas: New Works," through Oct. 17; McMurtrey Gallery, 3508 Lake; 713-523-8238, mcmurtreygallery.com .
Mark Fox: "Giverny: Journal of an Unseen Garden," video installation and photos; opens Saturday, through Nov. 28; Hiram Butler Gallery, 4520 Blossom; 713-863-7097, hirambutler.com .
Heavy Metal: Sculptural works by John Clement and Mac Whitney; through Oct. 31; Gallery Sonja Roesch, 2309 Caroline; 713-659-5424, gallerysonjaroesch.com .
Bo Joseph: "Souvenirs From Nowhere," through Oct. 22; McClain Gallery, 2242 Richmond; 713-520-9988, mcclaingallery.com .
Laura Lark: "The Misuses of Enchantment," through Oct. 24; Devin Borden Gallery, 3917 Main; 713-529-2700, devinborden.com .
Katja Loher: "Where Does Time Begin?," through Oct. 10; Anya Tish Gallery, 4411 Montrose; 713-524-2299, anyatishgallery.com .
Mary McCleary: "Voyage," through Oct. 17; Moody Gallery, 2815 Colquitt; 713-526-9911, moodygallery.com .
Kelly Moran: "Only Human," through Oct. 17; d.m. allison gallery, 2709 Colquitt; 832-607-4378, dma-art.com .
Tameka Norris: "Sole Rights," through Oct. 10; David Shelton Gallery, 3909 Main; 832-538-0924, davidsheltongallery.com .
Demetrius Oliver: "Anemometer," through Oct. 24; Inman Gallery, 3901 Main; 713-526-7800, inmangallery.com .
Quartets: Solo show by Tony Magar; through Oct. 17; Laura Rathe Fine Art, 2707 Colquitt; 713-527-7700, laurathe.com .
Leslie Parke: "Everything Is Real," through Oct. 10; Gremillion & Co. Fine Art, 2501 Sunset; 713-522-2701, gremillion.com .
Jacqueline Dee Parker: "Pole Dancing on the Axis Mundi" and "Ward Sanders: Howling Fantods: A Tribute to David Foster Wallace," through Oct. 17; Hooks-Epstein Galleries, 2631 Colquitt; 713-522-0718, hooksepsteingalleries.com .
Susan Plum: "Soul Retrieval," through Oct. 31; Deborah Colton Gallery, 2445 North; 713-869-5151, deboracoltongallery.com .
Miguel Angel Rios: "Endless," through Nov. 21; Sicardi Gallery, 1506 W. Alabama; 713-529-01313, sicardigallery.com .
Luz María Sánchez and Maja Ruzni: "Ya no llevó el Nahual/Babaroga je dosla (because the boogeyman is here)," through Nov. 7; She Works Flexible, 1709 Westheimer; 713-522-0639, sheworksflexible.com .
Katia Santibanez: "New Paintings," through Oct. 17; Texas Gallery, 2012 Peden; 713-524-1593, texgal.com .
David Scheinbaum: "Kalós," through Oct. 17; Catherine Couturier Gallery, 2635 Colquitt; 713-524-5070, catherinecouturier.com .
Tim Schneider: Landscape paintings; opens 6 p.m. Saturday, through Nov. 15; DesignWorks, 2119A Postoffice, Galveston; 409-766-7599.
Songs of Lao: Photographs by Kenro Izu and Yumiko Izu, through Oct. 24; Booker-Lowe Gallery, 5623 Feagan; 713-880-1541, -bookerlowegallery.com .
Stories in Steel: Works by sculptor Ed Wilson, through Nov. 19; Heritage Plaza Lobby, 1111 Bagby; artsbrookfield.com .
University of Houston-Downtown Faculty Exhibition: Works by Mark Cervenka, John Davis, Gaby Hernandez, El Franco Lee II, Floyd Newsum, Mason Rankin, Beth Secor and Kaneem Smith, through Dec. 5; O'Kane Gallery, University of Houston Downtown, One Main; 713-221-8042, uhd.edu .
